Chicago.Gate of Horn: The Gate of Horn was a 100-seat folk music club, located in the basement of the Rice Hotel at 755 N. Dearborn St. at the corner of Chicago Avenue, on the near north side of Chicago, Illinois, in the 1950s and 1960s. It was opened by journalist Les Brown  and Albert Grossman in 1956 and was where Odetta, Bob Gibson, Roger McGuinn and others made their name.
